hints.content:
The first bar lines up to $\redD{5}$.   

![A vertical bar graph. Number of Dogs is on the vertical axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Dog Breed is on the horizontal axis.  There are bars for each of the Dog Breeds. The first bar is 5. The second bar is 7. The third bar is 4. The fourth bar is 2. The first bar is labeled 5 at the top.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/247c975bb7df19f9460ffac78ead5a1678e1177f)

Which dog breed has $\redD{5}$ dogs?

Dog breed  | Number of dogs 
:- | :-: 
Boxer | $\redD{5}$  

There are $\redD{5}$ boxers.  So, the first bar should be labeled $\redD{\text{Boxer}}$.
Now let's label the other bars to match the table.

Here is the completed graph:

![A vertical bar graph. Number of Dogs is on the vertical axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Dog Breed is on the horizontal axis.  There are bars for each of the Dog Breeds. The first bar labeled Boxer is 5. The second bar labeled Bulldog is 7. The third bar labeled Collie is 4. The fourth bar labeled Poodle is 2.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6047057b3509ac49cb78ae37a18e5d326ed29742)

question.content:
Catherine created a chart and a bar graph to show how many dogs of each breed the animal shelter put into good homes last year. 

Dog breed  | Number of dogs 
:- | :-: 
Bulldog | $7$ 
Boxer | $5$ 
Poodle | $2$ 
Collie | $4$ 

**Label each bar on the bar graph.**

[[â˜ƒ label-image 1]]

options.imageAlt: A vertical bar graph. Number of Dogs is on the vertical axis and has lines marking from 0 to 10. Dog Breed is on the horizontal axis.  There are bars for each of the Dog Breeds. The first bar is 5. The second bar is 7. The third bar is 4. The fourth bar is 2.
